title: Filtro Adaptativo y Módulo de Grabación en Dispositivo Para Mejora en la Calidad de Audición
author: Carlos Elihu Palomino Torres, Francisco Claudio Chichipe Mondragón, Frank Antonio Siesquen Rodriguez, Mariana Alexandra Huaynate León
relevance_why: This work presents a real-time auditory enhancement system using adaptive filters and artificial intelligence, which aligns with audio enhancement research and techniques that could be applicable to Haohe Liu's projects on audio processing.
background: Developing a real-time hearing aid device that uses adaptive filtering to improve sound clarity by minimizing background noise.
contribution: This project introduces an ESP32-based adaptive filtering device to enhance auditory perception in noisy environments, achieving clearer sound output.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous systems often lacked real-time adaptability or relied on fixed parameters, limiting their effectiveness in varying acoustic environments.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work employs a Least Mean Squares (LMS) adaptive filter that adjusts dynamically, improving the clarity of speech without manual intervention.

key_innovation: Dynamic adaptation of an LMS filtering algorithm integrated into a portable device for real-time noise suppression.
real_world_impact: This technology can significantly enhance the quality of life for individuals with hearing impairments, improving communication in noisy settings. It represents a step towards more adaptive and accessible hearing aids.
limitations: The effectiveness may vary in extreme acoustic conditions where noise patterns are highly variable, and the ESP32's processing power may limit filter complexity.

new_terms.Least Mean Squares (LMS): **Least Mean Squares (LMS)** is an adaptive filtering algorithm that iteratively adjusts filter coefficients to minimize the difference between a desired signal and the actual output.
new_terms.I2S: **I2S** is a serial bus interface standard that connects digital audio devices, enabling low-latency data transfer.
